title: Using LLM prompts
text:
AI in replicating human made designs and patterns



Chatbots

Hobbies

Crocheting



Although chatbots like ChatGPT have since improved from their initial stages, they still lack the creativity and knowledge in creating directions for certain activities. One such one I wanted to explore was crocheting.





Sep 23, 2025


Joy Wang

Learning

AI

Medicine



Colorectal cancer remains the second leading cause of cancer deaths in both men and women in the United States. But can image recognizing from AI be beneficial to the majority for once?

title: Professor G‚Äôs Great GPT
text:
Based on his book with the same title, Prof G fed ChatGPT every problem and lesson plan covered for the semester. For those taking MATH 1400 or MATH 1410, Calc Star Green/Blue has proven incredibly useful and helpful.



Calculus Blue, the book


The commands available include /intro, /ex, /score, and /test. Calling them for their purpose is fairly intuitive, while some like /score is when the user wants their test to be rated by an emoji or /go for a week‚Äôs specific material.



Calc Star Blue, the GPT


However as of September 14, when prompted to give information about Week Four, it limits itself to four of the nine learning objectives. It decided Week 4 was ‚Äúall about determinants as volume-scaling factors‚Äù. When asked about the rest of the learning objectives, it corrected itself and revised the response it gave to my original question for help. It now covered topics like orthogonal and orthonormal bases, linear transformations as matrices, and minor expansion in computing determinants.



Revision of response

Revision of response

title: AI in replicating human made designs and patterns
text:
Crochetings is defined as a ‚Äúprocess of creating textiles by using a crochet hook to interlock loops of yarn, thread, or strands of other materials‚Äù and is derived from the French word ‚Äòcrochet‚Äô meaning hook. There are many pieces techniques and steps to follow before a project, or design, can come to fruition. But the question still stands, can ChatGPT, or any chatbot really, give an answer that makes something decent? Chatbots are known to give information you have to double check yourselves in some way, shape, or form so what better way to test it than make something.
I gave openAI‚Äôs ChatGPT a single task, ‚Äúgive me a set of instructions to crochet a small black cat plushie for my witch costume‚Äù. It produced this: ## üß∂ Crochet Pattern: Mini Black Cat Plushie Skill level: Advanced beginner (basic stitches, working in the round) Yarn: Black worsted-weight Hook: 3.5‚Äì4 mm (E‚ÄìG) Other: Safety eyes (6‚Äì8 mm) or felt, stuffing, yarn needle, pink yarn/embroidery thread for nose, optional pipe cleaner for tail stiffness



MR = Magic Ring
sc = single crochet
inc = increase (2 sc in one stitch)
dec = decrease (sc 2 stitches together)
st(s) = stitch(es)
FO = fasten off
Body (worked in round, stuffed as you go)
MR, 6 sc (6)
inc around (12)
(sc, inc) around (18)
(2 sc, inc) around (24)
5‚Äì10. sc around (24)
(2 sc, dec) around (18)
(sc, dec) around (12)
dec around (6)
FO, sew closed.





MR, 6 sc (6)
inc around (12)
(sc, inc) around (18)
(2 sc, inc) around (24)
5‚Äì9. sc around (24)
(2 sc, dec) around (18)
(sc, dec) around (12)
Add safety eyes between rows 6‚Äì7, about 5 stitches apart.
dec around (6)
FO, sew closed.
Ears (make 2)
MR, 4 sc (4)
(sc, inc) twice (6)
sc around (6)
FO, leave tail for sewing.





MR, 6 sc (6)
2‚Äì10. sc around (6)
Stuff lightly or slide in pipe cleaner.
FO, sew closed.





MR, 6 sc (6)
(sc, inc) around (9)
3‚Äì5. sc around (9)
FO, stuff lightly.




Sew head to body. Attach ears on top of head. Sew legs to bottom sides of body. Attach tail to back. Embroider a tiny pink triangle nose + whiskers with white thread (optional).



Tiny felt witch hat glued on top. Purple ribbon collar with a little bell. Glow-in-the-dark yarn for eyes if you‚Äôre extra spooky.
To compare, I created another small black cat plushie from Storyland Amis. The results from both direction sets can be seen here:

title: Living With My Book, Part 1
text:
Written as a narrative explanation of the mathematics that has brought us machine learning (ML) and the ongoing explosion of artificial intelligence (AI), Ananthaswamy gives insight on the capabilities and limitations that come with such technology. ML systems are making what essentially are life-altering decisions for us, determining whether or not a tumor is benign, deciding if someone gets bail, or approving mortgages. They even seep into academic areas now with discoveries in chemistry, biology, extrsolar planets, and even qunatum systems. But one thing to not, though, is that this was all before large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT became popular.



Ananthaswamy‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhy Machines Learn‚Äù


This technology is based on relatively simple mathematical ideas, some of which go back centuries like linear algebra and calculus It took the birth and advancement of computer science and the use of 1990s computer chips designed for video games to unfurl the interest in the AI that we see today. And as Ananthaswamy puts it, ‚ÄúWe are living through a revolution in machine learning-powered AI that shows no signs of slowing down‚Äù.

title: Living With My Book, Part 1
text:

They even seep into academic areas now with discoveries in chemistry, biology, extrsolar planets, and even qunatum systems. Ananthaswamy‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhy Machines Learn‚Äù

title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purple‚Ä¶
But it is possible you first said green (don‚Äôt worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


It‚Äôs a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | ‚Äî | ‚Äî | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It get‚Äôs it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. üü™

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, I‚Äôll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: Panera‚Äôs Mac and Cheese
text:
First up, a popular chain that began in 1987 as St.¬†Louis Bread Company, a humble community bakery founded with a sourdough starter from San Francisco and a dream of putting a loaf of bread in every arm. Now, it operates as both Panera Bread¬Æ or Saint Louis Bread Co St.¬†Louis Bread Company in 48 states, the District of Columbia and Canada!



Panera's Mac and Cheese Bread Bowl


A fan favorite across the board (save for the people who are lactose intolerant). One of my favorite meals to eat when at Panera Bread and overall a ten across the board. Not only does it come with a great vehicle for the sauce, but the taste is phenomenal.

title: Can AI reduce the mortality rate of colorectal cancer?
text: Colorectal cancer starts in the large intestine and the longer it is left untreated, the more in spreads until it becomes impossible to treat. Unfortunately, by the time symptoms are apparent it is too late for treatements like radiation or surgery. Still, it‚Äôs been hypothesized and proposed in making use of machine learning to classify and identify cancerous tissue.

title: Can AI reduce the mortality rate of colorectal cancer?
text: Colorectal cancer starts in the large intestine and the longer it is left untreated, the more in spreads until it becomes impossible to treat. Unfortunately, by the time symptoms are apparent it is too late for treatements like radiation or surgery. Still, it‚Äôs been hypothesized and proposed in making use of machine learning to classify and identify cancerous tissue.

title: Can AI reduce the mortality rate of colorectal cancer?
text:
Machine Learning and Diagnosing
In the summer of 2024, I and several others worked to figure out if it was possible. Using the data from the University of Jyv√§skyl√§, we trained an AI model to determine whether or not the tissue contained signs of cancer.
 | 
The first round of sequencing and feature extraction resulted in an accuracy of about 0.619, or 61.9%. To really increase the power and accuracy, we sought to augment the pictures to ‚Äúcreate‚Äù more data as we did not have access to any other data. The final method we used was transfer learning where the predictions output layer was changed to 8, everything but the output layer was frozen, and images were of size 150 pixels x 150 pixels.
 | 
A confusion matrix, a table used in machine learning to evaluate the performance of a classification model provides a more detailed insight into a model‚Äôs peformance. We had produced two confusion matrixes, one with the 61.9% as stated above and the new one, after transfer learning, was 84.4%. The accuracy in predicting eight categories of colorectal tissue grew tremendously, and this AI is capable of being integrated with other models.
 | 
However, there are pitfalls and issues with this way of testing and researching. For one, it creates biases in recognition as, without knowing for certain who the samples were taken from, the data is limited to one group. But different races and genders have symptoms specific to their group, and in the age where AI does often discriminate based on who trains them, there is a lot of room for error. In addition, there is already a distrust and dislike for AI seeping into every corners of the world, especially when it concerns the wellbeing of others and themselves. Relying on any AI to accurately determine and diagnose the cause is and will always be incredibly dangerous without further confirmation from a human‚Äôs eye.
For further interest: The University of Jyv√§skyl√§ and our in-depth examination Precision Medicine in Colorectal Cancer

title: About
text: Hi! My name is Joy and I am an all-around curious and creative person who loves exploring new ideas, solving problems, and making things. Coding is my passion, besides web design. This started out as a project for my communications class, shout out to you Professor O‚ÄôDonnell, and I wanted to continue with it! I am currently studying compuuter science with a concentration in Artificial Intelligence at the University of Pennsylvania and in my free time, I like to crochet amigurumis.
